thread.title: Jacqui Oatley appears to laugh off Paul Ince's "Darling" comment as former Man United star receives mixed feedback
thread.title_full: Jacqui Oatley appears to laugh off Paul Ince's "Darling" comment as former Man United star receives mixed feedback

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Jacqui Oatley appears to laugh off Paul Ince's "Darling" comment as former Man United star receives mixed feedback
text:
Sport Jacqui Oatley appears to laugh off Paul Ince's "Darling" comment as former Man United star receives mixed feedback The pair were at loggerheads over the involvement of video technology in football following its use in the France vs Spain international friendly Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Paul Ince calls Jacqui Oatley 'darling' on ITV Share this video Get football   
ITV presenter Jacqui Oatley appeared to laugh off Paul Ince's "Darling" comment on live TV Tuesday night, which has since received mixed feedback from viewers. 
The pair were on ITV4 covering France's 2-0 home defeat to Spain, and had conflicting views over video technology in football. 
Video technology was used in the international friendly and helped settle two major incidents in the game. 
Early in the second half, Antoine Griezmann headed home to put the hosts 1-0 up. However, the notch was disallowed after the video assistant referee adjudged the Atletico Madrid forward to be offside. Ince has received mixed feedback on his "Darling" comment (Photo: ITV 4) 
In the second half, Gerard Deulofeu was ruled offside as he tapped home 13 minutes from time. But video technology was on hand once again to reverse the linesman's incorrect decision. 
Naturally, video technology's influence on the match led to Oatley and Ince discussing its introduction. Ince was against the idea and suggested it may take five years for him to warm to it. Oatley appeared to laugh off Ince's comment (Photo: ITV 4) 
The former Manchester United star said that "getting decisions right takes the emotion out of the game" and "football is all about right and wrong decisions". 
Whereas Oatley argued the decision being right is the most important factor. 
The presenter also stated that the introduction of video technology would see a decrease in the abuse referees, linesmen and fourth officials receive. 
While Ince admitted that was a "positive", he was still unsure about the concept, and added: "We'll have another chat [about video-technology] in five years' time, darling." Ryan Giggs and Paul Ince in 1994 (Photo: John Peters/Manchester United) 
Oatley laughed his comment off and responded: "Alright darling, I'll look forward to that." 
Following his comment, Ince has since received mixed feedback from viewers: 
James Dornan on Twitter said: "Paul Ince complaining that technology got two 'wrong' decisions right. Football all about wrong decisions. Then called presenter Darling." 
Daniel Green on Twitter said: "Paul ince just called the host on itv4 darling. Good chance of him getting sacked after that." 
And London Raider added: "Does anyone know what the hell Paul Ince is on about? #FRAESP and he just called her darling? What a prat." 
But Ince did receive some defence from the online community: 
Harry on Twitter said: "Paul Ince getting bashed for saying darling? Grow up people. That's pretty much slang. If it offends you? Get over your self." 
Ryan Arthur on Twitter said: "People need to chill out over Paul Ince calling the presenter 'darling'. Must be bored!!" 
While another added: "Paul Ince called the presenter darling, what's the big deal lol. Call her a 'mate' instead?" 
Mirror Football has contacted Jacqui Oatley for a comment. Like us on Facebook
